rename.from: Add unit tests for the module

body: We can use https://www.gaia-gis.it/fossil/libspatialite/index to test SQL queries without querying BQ directly
I can take a look at this this weekend! So main idea is to create test fixtures from a SQLite DB

Some notes:
- Create a SQLite `source` test database by loading Philippine shapefiles from Geofrabrik. Check [this](https://www.gaia-gis.it/gaia-sins/spatialite-tutorial-2.3.1.html#t3.2) tutorial. Although I don't think we'll need the whole thing, especially if we're going to `commit` this? Maybe just get via `wget` instead
- The same goes for a `test` database of points
- https://www.gaia-gis.it/gaia-sins/BLOB-Geometry.html
- Use `AsText`
- Just load the `CSV` with `WKT` columns into the db

```python
import sqlite3
conn = sqlite3.connect('test_source.sqlite')
conn.enable_load_extension(True)

try:
    conn.load_extension('mod_spatialite.so')
except OperationalError:
    conn.load_extension('libspatialite.so')

cursor = conn.cursor()
cursor.execute(QUERY)
```

More info on [`mod_spatialite.so`](https://www.gaia-gis.it/fossil/libspatialite/wiki?name=mod_spatialite)

issue.title: Add tests

milestone.title: Open-Source Compliance
milestone.description: Ensure that Geomancer is compliant to our open-source standards. There should be tests, continuous integration, API documentation, and README set up for this whole thing.

repository.name: geomancer
repository.description: Automated feature engineering for geospatial data

issue.body:
Resolves #14 

This requires a test `sqlite` database. It's  around 400 MB so I didn't decide to commit it. My suggestion is that everytime it performs a check, it downloads the `sqlite` file then execute `pytest`

## Things I need second opinion on:
- How I loaded the spatialite extension in `backend.cores.sqlite`. I used an event listener, not sure if that's the best solution.
- My test cases in `tests.spells.distance_to_nearest`. There should be a better way to do that, not quite sure yet.

I am also testing on BigQuery, but that can be triggered off via:

```s
$ pytest -m "not bqtest"
```

## How to run the tests

1. Ensure that you have the test `.sqlite` file in `tests/data/source.sqlite`. I'll upload this in GCS soon
2. Go to root directory of the project then run:

```s
$ pytest
```

"works on my machine..."

![Screenshot from 2019-03-11 21-20-15](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12949683/54126892-8b2d2500-4443-11e9-8551-ef2c65b505d5.png)


![coverage](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12949683/54127197-350cb180-4444-11e9-93ad-3f73fc600f87.png)


## Next steps (for next sprint)

- Write tests for helper functions in `backend.bq` 
- Refactor, if needed, tests in spell
